meta.article_title: May 6, 2019 - Playing Against Short Pips on the Forehand

playing_against_short_pips_on_the_foreha.probleme: Playing Against Short Pips on the Forehand
causes_communes: Pips-out players are notoriously good attacking short, spinny balls

debutant.probleme: Short, very low no-spin serves to the forehand
debutant.solution: Counter-attack against these weaker opening loops.

debutant.probleme: Long, low, heavy pushes, especially to the wide corners
debutant.solution: Counter-attack against these weaker opening loops.

debutant.probleme: Deep backspin serves to the forehand
debutant.solution: Counter-attack their opening shot, often to the wide backhand.

intermediaire.probleme: Attack the middle. Pips-out players have to stay close to the table to be effective
intermediaire.solution: If you attack their middle (the mid-point between their forehand and backhand), they are rushed even more.

avance.probleme: Aggressive loops deep to the forehand and middle
avance.solution: Move the ball around from wide forehand to the middle so they have to move as well.

avance.probleme: In rallies, keep the ball deep
avance.solution: This both makes it harder for the pips-out player to smash, and gives you more time to react to their pips-out shots.

erreurs_a_eviter.probleme: Playing too far back, getting jammed and out of position
erreurs_a_eviter.solution: Move forward to attack the middle.
